Reviews.Title: “Not excellent but not bad!”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed hear in November last year. We were put in a rather small room on the 1st floor to the front of the building with the main road but we did not mind. Breakfast was ok not the best. The one thing that will stick in my head about this hotel for the rest of my life is me and my wife returning to our room mid afternoon and all we could hear was the sound of a man and woman doing the what seemed to be a good afternoons work. But as i said not a bad hotel but not an excellent one. Perfect if you are just looking for somewhere to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ashley b
Reviews.Content: We were two days ago in Rome, and although there was rain, we were very good. The hotel is very nice and clean and our room overlooked on via cavour, a bit noisy but very nice. We passed on Easter day visiting attractions and many shops were open. We tasted the traditional cuisine of Easter day, very good and rich in flavours. Thanks to Virgilio and Bartalo very nice in the information they gave us.

Reviews.Title: “The room with an excellent location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CascadeEspoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Borromeo Hotel in Rome 26-30.3. and 1-2.4.2012. The hotel staff reserved a taxi for us from Fiumicino airport to the hotel (50 euros). After landing we were at the hotel in one hour in the very heart of Rome. The hotel is an old palace. First we stayed at the first floor - and the room was cosy and beautifully furnished and decorated. It resembled the hotel in Stresa owned by the Borromeo family where we stayed last autumn. During our second visit we stayed at the second floor facing Via Cavour. Still the room was very quiet though there is some traffic. The whole staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and versatile and well maintained and serviced by a kind lady. The hotel location could not be better if you value the closeness of main attractions of Rome (Colosseum, Forum Romanum, Forum Augustus, Piazza Veneto...). S.Pietro in Vincoli (Michelangelo`s Moses, chains of Saint Pietro) and Santa Maria Maggiore churches are reachable with five minutes walk. The main railway station Stazione Termini is reachable in ten minutes walk as also is the Teatro dell Opera. There is regular train connection from Termini to the airport every 30 minutes, costs 14 euros. Metro station Cavour is within 2 minutes walk. One trip (90 minutes) costs 1 euro. Forum Romanun is within 10 minutes walk. Close to Borromeo Hotel there are very many and excellent trattorias and restaurants offering good Italian food with fixed price menus (10-15 euros). We made a sidetrip to Nice and had our main luggage stored at the hotel. We were extremely satisfied with choosing Borromeo Hotel for our stay and I am certain thet we will use this hotel again during future visits to Rome! Our best wishes to the nice staff at the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: andye d
Reviews.Content: It was so much that we wanted to give us a journey and finally we succeeded.Rome is a beautiful city. This hotel is beautiful and the staff is fantastic. They gave us many useful insights to visit the main tourist attractions without any difficulty. The hotel is very comfortable and the breakfast was served in a very delightful terrace. We were really good and we want to leave a warm greeting to the staff, Mr Alessandro, Virgilio, Bartalo.

Reviews.Title: “two beautiful days”
Reviews.Author: albert w
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful days in Rome and we stayed at this hotel really charming.Rome is a beautiful city and the mild climate has made us really live this holiday in the best possible way. The hotel is very nice and offers many comforts. Breakfast is served in a pretty terrace and the hotel staffs are very kind and prepared.We would like to thank especially Mr. Virgilio and Mr Alessandro for their kindness and for souvenirs that have offered us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kal F
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose this hotel for location and for quality/price and we definitely did the right. Hotel Borromeo is in the middle of main attraction of Rome and you can easily walk everywhere in a short time. Room very spacious and breakfast amazing good. The lady makes a nice cappuccino. The staff helps you in every request. Thanks to Alessandro, Bartoldo, Daniele and Virgilio.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent Rome”
Reviews.Author: jhon w
Reviews.Content: Prepared and helpful staff. Rooms are bright, comfortable and always very clean. Courtesy and customer focus are the watchwords. two romantic vacation, in the Centre of the eternal city is the perfect location.The impression was immediately good thanks to the central location, the metro immediately forthcoming.Continuing in the living room, we walked together with ease thanks to a booklet given to us by Mr Virgilio with useful information for visiting this beautiful city. Mr. Bartalo has recommended a good restaurant where we ate very well. We were really good and I recommend everyone to do this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room”
Reviews.Author: NgYM
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. Just 10-12 mins walk from the Termini Station. It's located on one of the main roads in Rome (Via Cavour) so it's probably not easy to become lost. It's also only 15mins walk from the Colloseum. In fact most of the attractions in Rome are within walking distance (with the exception of the Vatican), we walked most of the time and the location of this hotel helped alot. Room: I dont know about others but our double room is HUGE. Clean and comfortable. The toilet is big as well. The only complaint i have is that the 'double' bed is actually 2 single beds pushed together. Breakfast: Typical self-service continental style buffet breakfast. Limited hot food (scrambled eggs and something else) but everything else is there (bread/toast, fruits/yoghurt, coffee, pies/cakes, croissant etc). We liked the breakfast. Conclusion: Big, clean and comfortable room, excellent location. Tip from the airport: If you choose to take a taxi, only take the white cabs queued in front of the airport. Don't get persuaded into taking the unofficial dodgy taxis!

Reviews.Title: “a good location”
Reviews.Author: abigail a
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location to see many monuments of this fantastic city moving only with transportation, and it was very easy, thanks to a map that provided us with the hotel. The staff is really fantastic and always polite to every request. The hotel is decorated in a delightful and is kept very clean. We were really good and we will try to get back as soon as possible, there is no lack absolutely nothing and that is why we want to thank Alessandro goalkeepers, Bartolo, Virgilio for their kindness and Igor for the cleanliness of our room

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice service!”
Reviews.Author: Rudolph2011
Reviews.Content: When we went to Rome last april, it was so crowded due the the beatification of Karol Wojtyla, the citi was more crowded than usual, and finding a place was difficult, affortunately we made reservatios and got this good hotel, pricy, by the season as I can see the prices nowdays. After walking hours in rome and coming from overseas traveling almost 24 hs, we found a nice room, quiet space. Nice and friendly staff and a great breakfast service. The hotel is near to many attractions, so walking was a good idea. But there is a subway or metro station at walking distance. Many cafes nearby, safe neighborhood. Near to local boutiques with great deals. I will get back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “inspired choice”
Reviews.Author: smile s
Reviews.Content: Our was an inspired choice cuz we found ourselves really well. Our room was not very big but had all the amenities that pamper yourself like when you're on vacation. Breakfast is served on the terrace and is typical. The service of this hotel is very good and the staff is really fantastic, welcomed us very well, giving us a map with lots of useful information. The night Porter is always present and very kind to all questions. Visit

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing start followed by a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LH8507
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were told that we had been upgraded to a suite. We were initially very happy about this however the quality of the suite (room 97) was far far below a 3 star standard. It was not in the main part of the hotel but up a back staircase next to a staff room or office.The rooms were dirty and smelly, cold, there was a leaking tap, black marks in the bath, a hole in the bedroom door, no plug in the bath and a large number of ants crawling around (we even found one on our young baby the next morning). We were so disappointed with the standard of the room that we considered leaving Rome the following day (we had already paid for the room for 4 nights). We complained about the room to the hotel handyman who was extremely helpful and understanding. It turned out that we had not been upgraded but had been put in the room temporarily as all furnished rooms were occupied and we were due to be moved to a furnished room the following day. This had not been mentioned at check in and I am therefore doubtful as to whether we would have been moved if we had not complained. The following day we were moved to a furbished room which was an excellent standard for a 3 star hotel. It was very clean with nice and new furnishings. The breakfast is basic but with lots of choice everyday. We were also provided with a cot for the baby at no additional cost (initially we were told it would cost 15 EUR a day but after the suite incident the charge was waived). Unfortunately the cot did not have a mattress and instead had a wooden base covered in a few sheets so we had the baby in the spare bed instead. Overall we had a good stay in this hotel. The location is excellent, a short walk from both the main station (no need to get the metro) and the Colosseum. It was a shame about the first night as we would have definitely rated the hotel at least 4 if we had not been put in the terrible first room with no explanation at the time of check in.

Reviews.Title: “extraordinarily repaid”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey a
Reviews.Content: We are pleased to have had the pleasure of having spent well and feel good in this hotel. the kindness of the staff was above our expectations, alessandro, bartalo virgilio really excellent to information. Breakfast well-served by silvana. very clean room, handy man by igor. These are details that are important to the quality. We guarantee for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel experience...”
Reviews.Author: CJCPHXAZ
Reviews.Content: To Begin: This hotel was reccommend by a travel agent friend as a very nice budget hotel. When I asked him to book it for me, he actually advised me to make it myself, as the cost was cheaper on the hotel's own website (Since we were staying 5 nights, we got a 20% discount). OK, as for the hotel. Great location for the traveler who likes to use public transportation. We arrived at FCO at 9:00am, took the Leonardo Express to the Termini and it was not even 10:00 when we arrived at the hotel. While it was to early to check-in, they gladly secured our luggage and allowed us into our room at 12:30 (well before the 2:00 check in) (at at no additional cost). The hotel is about 1/2 way between the Termini Metro Station and the 1st stop on the B line (Cavour). There are a wide selection of restaurants, shops, etc all around, and a little market (KS Market) ascross the street that we wisited daily for wateer and juice when we would come back to the hotel The room: Was just about perfect for us. 1 double bed, a desk with TV and a wardrobe. More than enough room for our clothes and luggage. The bed was firm yet soft, and the housekeeping gladdly gave us extra pillows (Since the ones provided were rather flat). The room was warm and dry (nice since was raining outdoors), and the tempature was easy to control. As for the bathroom. Quaint would be a good descriptin. Average in size for a Old Rome hotel, but was pleasantly surprised by the size of the shower. It had all the necessaties and while the cold water was a bit hard to regulate, the HOT was envigorating. Only 2 items to note: In our room the TV had no sound (not that we watched a lot, but there were a few hours to kill with the rain and all), and the bed was the only place to sit, as there were no chairs in the room. Ammenties: The Internet (wifi is available and has a strong signal, but not included in the price (The Desk clerk said 1E per hour, was actually 2E), and you pay for it in blocks of 1 hour at a time. The breakfast in the morning was acceptable. It is not the best or the worst by any means. Decent selection, from traditional Italian favorites, to eggs and (greasy) bacon (I would have preferred that the eggs not had the bacon intermixed with the Bacon since my travel companion does not eat pork, he was not able to enjoy them), and a reasonable selection of pastries, fruit, cereal and beverages. Better yet, it was included in the rate of the room. Price, this trip for me was last min and had to be planned on a budget. I was so happy to have received all of this for just around $300 (6 days 5 night / Sun - Fri). This was my 5th visit to rome and this is the first time I have ventured out to a different hotel. I would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “rome in the snow”
Reviews.Author: edgher.p
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome during the week of cold weather and we enjoyed seeing the Colosseo and the streets filled with snow, very evocative.The boys enjoyed between various glide or to dash snow.To return to the hotel we had frozen from the cold. We asked if we could have some hot tea, the staff of the hotel was a family friendly, in addition to helping with internet, because our line had stopped ten minutes before, they gave us complimentary other fifteen minutes and kindly asked us if we had been good in the hotel and if the whole trip had satisfied our holiday. The hotel rooms were clean and very beautiful, heating a little hot. Standard breakfast.Recommend this hotel, a greeting to all the staff for the kindness, Alessandro, Bartalo, Daniele, Virgilio and Francesco.

Reviews.Title: “happy for the choice”
Reviews.Author: gregory s
Reviews.Content: Here's what happens when you travel and you are right, the return is nostalgic and tell friends to the cultural wonders and majesty of this great city, which despite years of history, always excites us to walk on roads where the ancient knowledge was only on written pages storia.Siamo were delighted in the alleys and fountains rappresentateda monuments and sculptures. Regarding restaurants Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Navona and the Campo di Fiori you have a choice. Our hotel was efficient in every expectation. Thanks to the staff of Alessandro, Bartolo, Daniele, Francesco and Virgilio, who have given a simple map of useful information. It is the openness that makes the pleasure of staying at this hotel that has nothing to envy in those cold five-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “rome beautiful”
Reviews.Author: fiona k
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights at this hotel really beautiful, decorated with beautiful marbles. our room was on the third floor and was equipped with a terrace with a limited view but equally interesting. the room was not very big, but it was a good room. the breakfast was good and fresh but there was fruit.ci was very surprised at check in where the reception staff was very polite and prepared. There have been accompanied to the room by a guy named Igor who carried our luggage and gave us directions to the light and television. thanks to Mr. Alessandro and Mr. Virgilio who left us a map with directions to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service but great location”
Reviews.Author: fishface3463
Reviews.Content: We arrived @ 3pm, checked in, opened the door to our room to find it wasn't cleaned. Rubbish from previous guests, no linen at all on the bed, 2full bins, bathroom still 'wet' from the last person showering. We went back down to reception. Were asked to go back up to the room to meet the head cleaner there, I couldn't see the point in us having to meet someone in the room, they wld clearly be able to see the mess it was in& I didn't feel we needed to 'discuss' it - the room simply hadn't been serviced between guests so please could we have a room that had. We couldn't. We had to wait for nearly 50mins in the reception while that particular room was serviced. It had been allocated to us so couldn't be changed. Not a great start!! The room was very small with a 'No view' window but perfectly usable for our stay, the breakfast was ok, passable when the lady refilled the trays but we've had Alot better in Rome. Linen, towels, shower & room condition we all good. As ever we had an amazing time in Rome, avoiding the tourist rip off joints and this Hotel was very well places for walking everywhere, we never used the Metro at all. If The Hotel got it's act together it would be one we'd use time and again.

Reviews.Title: “Arrivederci Roma.....”
Reviews.Author: sean c
Reviews.Content: Waiting for a flight connection here in Zurich.... Arrivederci Roma and Borromeo... Rome is always the best, the Borromeo a ggod surprise. We often come to Rome and it was the first time we used the Borromeo... The hotel is charming and nice, the staff is excellent, the room was new and very clean, the breakfast excellent and with lots of food.... No bad points at all....We will use it again in our next trip... A plus: the price was right..... Arrivederci Rome, arrivederci Borromeo!!

Reviews.Title: “Borromeo Hotel has a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: CushyCouple
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Borromeo in mid October 2011. The best thing about this hotel is that it has a great central location for people who like to walk, like my husband and me. It is located on Via Cavour, just a few blocks from Rome’s Termini. The area around the hotel was fine, in spite of its close proximity to Termini. Upon our arrival, we had a pleasant walk from Termini, dragging our small carry-on suitcases. In fact, after checking out, we didn’t not take a ridiculously expensive taxi back to Termini. Instead, we walked downhill one block to the very conveniently located Metro Station and rode it back to Termini for 1 Euro each! Our room was small by US standards but it was an OK size room by Rome standards. It was very clean and we had a very comfortable bed. Our room also had a window looking onto a courtyard. It was nice to have fresh air in our room. Our bathroom was always very clean too. The breakfast room is enclosed, on the roof. (There is also a second patio a few feet away which is open air.) The breakfast food was standard fare and very nicely presented. The lady in charge was very pleasant too. We discovered a small street behind the hotel when we exited the Metro Station one afternoon. This discovery proved to be quite helpful. This is evidently a “local’s” trove of little stores, as well as an Internet Café, a fantastic bakery, and a pizza shop! In fact, one afternoon, we bought a pizza and took it up to Borromeo’s roof top patio and enjoyed our pizza in the afternoon sun of a wonderful Rome afternoon! Being 3 weeks into our month long trip to Italy, we desperately need a laundry! Lucky for us, Borromeo’s Front Desk staff directed us to a laundry almost directly across Via Cavour from the Borromeo. The lady there said she’s have our laundry done and folded in a few hours and for a very reasonable price! We were delighted! Only problem we had at Hotel Borromeo was using the Internet which we really needed after being out of connectivity for 10 days on a Mediterranean cruise. We absolutely failed to get Internet service in the hotel! We asked the Front Desk for assistance, but they were not helpful at all, which was really disappointing. They refused to let us hard-wire to the Internet as a previous hotel had allowed. They directed us to the Internet Café on the small street behind the hotel. To make a long story short (and it is a long story!) , the explanation we were given at the Internet Café was that you cannot use Outlook Express in Italy. We’re still not sure this is true! Getting on the Internet was very important for us and we really appreciated Igor’s assistance. He is a staff member -- in some capacity -- of the Hotel Borromeo. He was very willing to help, but with the dismal results. On the other hand, the Front Desk staff acted like they didn’t really care and did not try to be helpful at all. The non-refundable rate we paid for the Hotel Borromeo was reasonable for Rome, and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who’s more interested in what’s going on in Rome – than the inside of the hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Nicholle M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convienently located close to the Colesseum, Metro Station and Termini Train station. My friend, her 18 year old daughter and I stayed here for 1 week in a 3 bed room. The room was clean and comfortable as well as the bathroom. The continental breakfast is located on top floor which was nice to have every morning! Another plus was lots of souvenior shops and food places as soon as you step out the lobby door! Also the staff spoke English and Spanish which was very helpfull !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Chaunte
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this hotel. It was our first trip to Europe and we were with two children, nine and seven. Hotel staff was not particulary nice or n Americn standard but they were helpful and tried to help you out in various occaions. The hotel was very clean and well air-onditioned although room was small, which I would expect to be normal for Europe. the hotel was very convenintly located nearby Colloseum and Metro. The breakfast was nice on the patio.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice, well positioned hotel. Ideal for a break!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaWooldridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Hotel Borromeo which is a small but very nice hotel, ideally positioned near both the main station, the Colosseum and one of the metro lines. The staff were hugely helpful, providing us with information, maps and more that really helped us get around. The room was very clean - not huge but with a pleasant and spotlessly clean bathroom. The hotel was also close to a number of other attractions and there were plenty of places to eat nearby. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Swansky88
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was situated in the heart of Rome and very close to the Colosseum and other attractions. Also the train station was very close so for those who like to travel to other parts of Italy, this is a great location. The room was quite small, but we survived. Sometimes you could feel the metro under your feet when you were standing in your room. People in the corridor where pretty noisy early in the mornings, which was not so nice. Breakfast was okay. The staff was friendly though and helped us whenever we needed help. As a budget hotel, I could recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family friendly/central option”
Reviews.Author: hayhillbillies
Reviews.Content: Clean, functional and central. We had a quadruple bedroom (not facing the street which admittadly we were relieved about). Good value for money and within easy wlking distance of termini station (for the airport) and all the sights. Perfectly eadible breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “top choice”
Reviews.Author: axel m
Reviews.Content: A real nice stay in Rome in this hotel for a lovely breakdown with my wife. The forecast was extremely nice and sunny for Rome and we decided to have a lastminute breakdown, so we booked the flight and this hotel the day befaore to travel. The hotel is nice, well located and extremely clean. Excellent room, enough big, very bright and very clean(so important for us). We were treated very gently from all the staff and thanks to all of them to make our stay memorable. We have been many times in Rome, and we think this was the best hotel we have been in. A good complimentary buffet included served on the terrace. All the most important sights were close and we loved to walked all day long. Truly suggested.

Reviews.Title: “like a very bad NHS experience”
Reviews.Author: CAndrews_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for too many nights. Yes the hotel is located in the heart of Rome. Just 10 minutes walk to the Colloseum 5 minutes walk to the main train station. Room is quite small for a 3 star hotel. Toilet/shower room is very tiny as well. Towels are not changed everyday, which is a bit surprising. When we questioned the staff why towels were not changed everyday they became very defensive. Breakfast was good and it was in the terrace. The staff were really rude especially one of the chambermaids who became very defensive when we asked why towels were not changed. There was also another staff in the dining hall who shouted at us when we had a second serving. It was a buffet breakfast so you can help yourself but someone actually shouted at us and said NO!. The only friendly staff is in the reception. The management of Borromeo Hotel should instill in the minds of their staff that the customers are paying for their wages. They need proper customer service training, honestly. Don't waste your time and money in this hotel. There hundreds of hotels in Rome and there are few more down the same street where Borromeo Hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “disorganized”
Reviews.Author: 119traveler119
Reviews.Content: We had booked a double room and paid in advance. When they showed us to our room it was tiny with a single bed!!!!! I complained to the front desk and they said they just didn't have a double room for us (so annoying and unprofessional) for that night, so they squeezed a cot into the room. on the second night we finally got the room we paid for. location was great, breakfast ok. Will not be recommending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nymisi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Termini, Colosseum and city center. There are 2 bus stops located almost in front of hotel - with the buses you can go directly to Piazza Venezia and Largo Chigi. The underground station is in 3 minutes walk. We stayed 3 nights, the first night in a suite, the other two in a double room. Each room were tidy, clean and comfortable. Even the suite looked to the busy Via Cavour it was silent, thanks to the soundproof windows. The double room looked to back, and it was silent as well. However we heard when an underground train passed, it was not disturbing at all. The staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast was reasonable, but it was a bit boring in the 3rd day, since the same standard food served each time - you can eat in a nice roof garden. Anyway the weakest point was the food. I booked the room 2 months in advance, and it was very cheap at that time.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kaatethecat
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be very central to all sites to be visited. Lovely bedroom with AC and our own private terrace...what a bonus. Staff very helpful and great breakfast included in the price..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: acyvr
Reviews.Content: We were given a room at this hotel after our original hotel had a problem. The location of Hotel Borromeo is excellent, within easy walking distance of Termini, down via Cavour just past Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was small, but nicely tiled. The bathroom was clean. Breakfast is included, and is served on the third floor terrace, so you can eat outside if you wish. Not much selection, but the coffee with hot milk is good. Wi-fi costs 2euro per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsWillis
Reviews.Content: It had AC!!! We stayed in a quad room on the first floor of the hotel. Breakfast was free (and nice) and the staff was helpful. They helped us coordinate a cab to the port for a lot less than expected!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience....”
Reviews.Author: ronin b
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience in this lovely hotel perfectly located in the city centre. We appreciated the great staff service and all the efforts to made our stay comfortable. Great room, newly refurbished with a fantastic bathroom(the shower was super). Plus we had a room on the third floor and we had a private big terrace where to have a drink coming back from the restaurant.I guess there are very few rooms with this option we were lucky. Breakfast was served on the same floor and it was rich and perfect to start the day. Last, we had a problem because we losted a wallet somewhere in the city and the hotel staff was very helpful to contact the police station and expained them what happened, and then expained us how to reach them to make the report.Very helpful!! I will surely come back in this hotel in a future visit to Rome, and I suggest this hotel 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: jenny l
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of days at Borromeo Hotel, the hotel is clean, cute also is a little small, in the heart of Rome... any site is close, just walking distance; breakfast was good and ritch, the terrace a surprise, the room perfect and tidy. Staff really helpfull and nice, thanks for the early check in, we also left our bags in a deposit for free. A very good place, value for money paid !!!! Graize Borromeo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Yonitt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were welcomed into our room very quickly by a very helpful bellhop who also sat with us and our two children with a map and explained for at least 20 minutes how to get to different attractions and restaurants in the area. It was wonderful to sit on the roof and eat breakfast although the selection was a bit limited. The room was very comfortable and clean. Great location - walking distance from the Colosseum and the Trevi wish fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Des L
Reviews.Content: Great place. Very reasonable. We moved to this hotel after one night in a dire 3 star hotel. Was refreshing to come here after the "other experience". Spotlessly slean. Marble floors gave it a cool and clean appearance. Staff were friendly and the roof top terrace for breakfast was a lovely suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast left something to be desired, but good locale”
Reviews.Author: CaperGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for about $120 CAD per night. The room itself was in fantastic condition, with a freshly renovated bathroom and A/C that WORKED. In summer-time Roma, that is a must! Hotel is an easy walk from Termini train station - it's right on the main street so very easy to find. This of course leads to a little road noise, but it didn't bother us. If you're a light sleeper, ear plugs would be recommended. It was also an easy walk from here to the Colesseum (15 minutes or so?). If you're not a walker, it's pretty close to the metro station as well. My one complaint about this hotel is the breakfast area, which is on the top floor. Don't eat the yogurt!! I'm not sure Italians have the same standards as North Americans for keeping cold foods cold and hot foods hot. My yogurt had mold in it... and the room itself was very, very warm. The selection was quite comparable to any other hotel we stayed at and was your typical Italian continental style. Overall - I'd recommend this hotel for those on a budget who are looking for easy access to the train station and to Roma's major sites. Just don't expect 4 star food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome, Beatiful Borromeo”
Reviews.Author: Bays
Reviews.Content: The location is very central easy to see everything by walking. The city is incredible every new day brings new delights. The hotel and room was very nice and very clean, we found the hotel great value the breakfast was top the lovely lady who works really hard to prepare it all is a real gem. If you are lucky enough to be able to travel to Rome stay at the Borromeo you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linnthesurfer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel next to the Colosseum(5 minutes).Good option to visit the city.Reasonable price.Great room and bathroom, all very clean and new.Excellent breakfast in a fantastic terrace on the top floor.Second time in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, small room, great breakfast, good deal!”
Reviews.Author: cat60745
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights in june. The room was very small, but it was very clean and had AC. There was also a elevator to get the baggage to the room, which was nice. The bed was rather hard, but we were so tired every night from touring the city that we had no problems sleeping at all. the best part of the hotel was the free breakfast on the roof every morning (inside and outside seating). good food, lovely area. the location of the hotel was good; 10-15 minutes from the spanish steps, 40-45 minutes walk to vatican. the area wasn't exactly picturesque, but i never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel late at night. it just wasn't a place i would pick to eat dinner, but all the cute rome communities were within walking distance (we are 20's, active people, don't mind walking). also, the train station is very close (10 min walk). overall, its a good price for a clean, small room, with a lovely breakfast, and everything within wakling distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruric
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel a lot. The room was clean and felt newly renovated. The breakfast as better than I expected and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HanibalDeKartago
Reviews.Content: Most of the things have already been said in previous reviews. We arrived early but the room was fortunately ready for us. We were a family with two teen-aged children and had booked a four bed room. The two rooms separated by a bath were not very big but OK. Although the room was towards the front street it was not very noisy and there may have been some fibrations from the metro it was not disturbing. The rooms were air conditioned. Breakfast was not too rich and late commers were punished by the decreasing selection. Service overall was "roman style" ie not very friendly but we had not really reasons to complain. The hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “...stay here....”
Reviews.Author: kelligotoofar
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel, good price, perfect location, great staff and renovated rooms. We found this hotel a little gem with all amenities we could have ask. Our room was precious with marble bathroom, Sky tv with hundreds channels free, strong wi fi connection, nice new beds.The breakfast is served on the 3rd floor in a nice terrace with lots of nice flowers, a gentle way to srat your day. The location is perfect, you do not need taxi or bus just walk in 5 minutes to the Colosseum and then continue to all the major sites of the city. Me and my boyfriend are sure we will come back in this hotel in a future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Kimdong
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a perfect location. Some friends suggested us to stay in this hotel and www booked trough email.We got a very good price and we had a free upgrade room on the third floor with a fantastic terrace. Renovated rooms, excellent breakfast. The staff was polite and helped us with all requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: PennyLane72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location - 10 mins from Collesium,Terminn,i 20mins from Via Veneto/Spanish Steps. The room was very clean, decent size, had all the amenities needed although if you have long hair I would advise taking your own hairdryer as the one in the room was less than adequate! Now we come to the staff - and what a shame as this let the hotel down - we arrived at 12.30pm only to be told check in was at 2pm we could leave our bags - no checking to see if the room was ready or not - not the best welcome very solemn faces. When we went back at 1.57pm to check in - the man looked at his watch and then proceeded to reluctantly check us in! There was no warm welcome in fact I was a little frightened of him!! Needless to say I didnt feel that I could ask any advice on the area as they seemed less than pleased to see us! The breakfast was ok - although juice and water had to be drunk from plastic cups, and again the lady who worked in there seemed unhappy to be working there! There was only fruit on one of the mornings - but there was a toaster, a variety of breads, and hard boiled eggs as well as the cheese and ham. Not sure if I would stay there again - I think I would look somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: Lele128
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude and unhelpful, rooms were small and buffet breakfast was a joke. We booked for only one night but were charged TWICE. When we asked the person at reception we were not given any proper assistance and when we finally got answers, we were told that the initial payment was a pre-authorisation payment and it will be refunded to us in 3 days. After 3 days, and no refund we were then told within 15 days, then again... by the end of the month. It is now the 6th of the next month and we are STILL WAITING. After countless emails, our last email has still gone unanswered. This Hotel is a JOKE. I suggest staying elsewhere if you want your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just missing free wifi”
Reviews.Author: paypar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station. We arrived via airport, and took a private bus that took us to Termini, and then walked from there. We packed light, so it wasn't too bad to walk. It is also 3 minutes from the Cavour metro, which we found really handy. You could also walk to the Colosseo if you were inclined. The rooms are SMALL, but they have everything you would need (except I would recommend bringing your own hair dryer and toiletries). The breakfast was in a large room on the 3rd floor and had the basics, breads cereal, coffee, boiled eggs. We did have a problem with the room safe, and we were immediately transferred to another room when we asked if that was an option. Four our four night stay, we paid a total of 436 euros including the service charge (which must be paid in cash). I just wish they offered free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “good surprise”
Reviews.Author: paulpicot32
Reviews.Content: We arrived fron Florence by train and we walked to the hotel in about 10 minutes.It was a nice surprise this Hotel with a good location, a shiny room and a perfect combination of services and courtesy. We loved the breakfast room on the top floor. Nice location with several hotels in the area and a very close to Colosseum and nice sights of Rome/

Reviews.Title: “A little delicious hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Londonfinney
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel lovely,clean and with an exceptional staff. I am always on a business trip,most of the time business hotels are "cold"....this little hotel was like stay home.Large room,marble bath,all was new and clean.Staff was always friendly and helpful, I suggest it with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Nokiaservice
Reviews.Content: It was a nice experience, this hotel is nice,very clean, perfectly located in Rome.I ve been with colleagues and we all appreciate the courtesy of the staff,they organized our very short free time in the city. Rooms were large and clean.We appreciate the fast wi-fi connection.Breakfast ok with good choice. I am planning a family trip in June to' Europe and Italy, I will surely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..”
Reviews.Author: Jmaier44
Reviews.Content: Little hotel with a great location,excellent service and a lovely roof for breakfast.We had a spacious room on the first floor with marble bathroom and fine decorations. This was the second time in Rome,we only stayed for 3 day s but we enjoyed the greatest food of the worldwide and lots of interesting museums, we had the chance to visit the exibition of Van Gogh,it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great vfm hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SusieBryce
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, don't go in the lift if the floor is not level with the floor you are leaving from; we went down below down and the doors opened on a concrete wall once! Felt like a Chilean miner! It went up again though...phew! Good value for money hotel. IGNORE ALL TOUTS in Rome! Do not get your foto taken with the "gladiators" at the Colosseum; they charge 5 euros each and will chase you down the road to get it... so will guys offering you a rose. Ignore the guides, too... the entrance to the Vatican is free, queues move fast. They say you'll be waiting for up to an hour and a half and by paying them 40 euros they'll bypass the queues...

Reviews.Title: “Lover this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dugongon
Reviews.Content: Clan and well located.Great Service and lovely staff.All you can need is at yr disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable - very good location”
Reviews.Author: CheerfulDragon
Reviews.Content: Our 1st visit to Rome - Borromeo was very easy to find from the Termini. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff helpful. Breakfast was adequate but not great. Location of hotel was the main thing for us- we saw all that we wanted to see and only used the buss once, Pantheon, Colosseum, Trevi, Vatican all walkable. Good selection of restaurants very close by, but get into the back streets for good value for money don't stay on the Via Cavour. La Carbonara restaurant well worth a visit. Still some renovation work going on at hotel but we were not troubled by it at all. Very pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “In 1 word.....perfect”
Reviews.Author: lamivida1
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel next to the Colosseum and the Roman Forums. We arrived late at night and we had immediately a nice impression of the Hotel. Got a room on the 3rd floor, nice, clean, spacious and with a fantastic marble bathroom. On the same floor there's a nice big breakfast room where you can enjoy an excellent morning breakfast.Lots of choices and a lovely lady serving it. We experienced a great stay, thanks also to all the staff, always ready to help. Plus: among the various restaurants in the area of the Hotel, don't miss Trattoria Urbana, just 2 mns. from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location? Yes. Stay again...nah.”
Reviews.Author: Astara8
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one to rate, because we were first-time visitors to Rome and honestly don't know what comparable hotels were like. But, these were our observations. PROs: Location, location, location. We were only a short walk from the colloseum, and most of the Old City. So, no need for cabs, buses or trains. Also, they do provide cable TV with channels in English, which was rare for our vacation in Italy. CONs: It just wasn't a special stay. For the price, I simply expected nicer accommodations and service. Overall, the photos were much more impressive than the room, which looked aged and crumbling, a bit. There was a strong mildew smell which bothered my allergies, so we had to open the window. The bathroom was quite cramped, and the shower curtain was so short that the entire bathroom was drenched every time we showered. We also paid for wireless internet, and it didn't work for most of our stay so we demanded a refund. Someone else to note that is neither pro nor con, is that the hotel's location is NOISY. You are on a very busy street and will hear every noise outside. But we were looking for that city experience and expected the noise. With this hotel, you must really choose what's most important. We had to look the other way in terms of several comforts in order to justify the proximity to the sights. For the money, I would hope that there is better elsewhere but can't say for sure.

Reviews.Title: “not room are the same”
Reviews.Author: TiaMia_27
Reviews.Content: Our room was very old and nasty, with a moldy bathroom.This was the worst hotel of the four we visited while in Italy. We were only in Rome for two nights and decide to make do since the linens were clean. When we were leaving, another quest was the front desk complaining. His room was falling apart and dirty, his friend's room was very nice, clean & had apparently been very recently updated. The desk clerk confirmed that not all the rooms have been updated yet, but tried to assure this man that his room "was fine". The customer did not agree since he & his friend were paying the same for their very different rooms. This hotel is in a good location and has a good breakfast. I would recommend booking this hotel only if you can be completely certain of an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Eh - it's OK.”
Reviews.Author: MeganM_08
Reviews.Content: The looks of this hotel were deceiving. The room was about the size of my closet. I didn't really mind, but the pictures are not accurate. The beds however, were painfully uncomfortable...not to mention the paper thin pillows. Thankfully, it was our first day in Italy, so we were dead tired and didn't mind. On the positive side, this hotel is right down the street from the train station. Close, but not too close. Wish I had known this before I arranged transportation from the airport. It's also very close to the Colosseum and a short taxi ride to other points of interest. The breakfast was "OK" at best. I didn't enjoy it at all, but my friend did. To each their own. Overall, I would recommend this as a 2 star hotel. It works, it's affordable, it's convenient...just don't expect a lot. Enjoy Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & desk guest service”
Reviews.Author: Michele32
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight to attend a wedding nearby. Requested an early check in so we could change before the wedding. Very helpful morning receptionist got us a room by 12.30 so that was great, and always ready for outstanding guest service. During the day time, little noisy at cause of some working progress for refurbishment to one of the hotel floor. We stayed 2 nights and had great advises for restaurants, attractions and tips to plan our daily visit around the city of Rome. Great location. So will be back as soon as we can. We would recommend for many travelling purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Unhelpful Reception Stall, Decent location”
Reviews.Author: m_mayhs
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was average. Breakfast was ok. But staff at reception was not helpful at all. They didn't even know the opening times for major attractions like Colloseum and Vatican. On one occasion I asked if there was a shop nearby so I could buy some water and I was told there are no shops in the area so I decided to go out and look for one. Just 20-30 meters away there was a shop selling water... The reception staffs were totally clueless. Rooms were ok and clean. Location was decent but not sure if I would stay here again. On the plus side there is a mini bar and safe in the room. Close to station and 10 mins walk to Colloseum. On a scale of 10, I’d rate this hotel 5.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "suite"”
Reviews.Author: moyagney
Reviews.Content: We arrived lst the first night as our planed didn't touch down until 10 pm. By the time we reache the hotel it was around 11 pm. We were told we were being given a suite for the first night and would have to move the next morning. We thought wonderful, but were puzzled why we were being upgraded to a suite. It soon became clear! It was a suite ... of sorts but more like poor accommodation for staff - holes in the doors, damp streaks on the walls of the bathroom, the shower unuseable, looked like it was infected with serious bacteria. However, we were moved to a better room (albeit tiny) the next day and staff were really friendly and helpful and any faults we had were rectified immediately. I Would recommend but please don't arrive late ... otherwise you could get the suite!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice nice nice”
Reviews.Author: turturro
Reviews.Content: What to say about this hotel.... nice, clean, perfect location, incredible staff... We loved everything, rooms are perfect, excellent A/C, beutiful marble bathroom, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and TV channels!”
Reviews.Author: AP_1Australia
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel. I stayed here for a week whilst I was in Rome and I found the location of the hotel to be fantastic. It is on a main street, Via Cavour, with many cafes/bars/restaurants in walking distance either side of the hotel. It is also close to Termini Station and bus stops. We found the staff to be so friendly. When we needed their help, they were at our room within a minute of calling. The room itself was also nice. The bathroom is a bit small but sufficient for your needs whilst you are on holiday. Great selection of foxtel channels too! Hotel room was very clean and the breakfast was delicious with tonnes of variety! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_Barile
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. I stayed for 6 nights and I can honestly say that I enjoyed every aspect of this hotel. The service was excellent, when we needed assistance (for example a scale to weigh some packages that we were sending home) they would send someone up to help us straight away - no waiting! Another great feature of this hotel was that the rooms were excellent - much better than I would expect for a 3-star hotel. They were the only hotel we stayed in with Pay TV available for no charge (with exception to the movies). The breakfast was fantastic - there was so much to choose from! I stayed at the Hilton Hotel at Fiumicino airport for 1 night when we were leaving to go home, but I was extremely disappointed at their services... Borromeo was a million times better than the Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “the best..”
Reviews.Author: paulina00000
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, perfect location, excellent breakfast and staff. Really the best hotel I ve stayed in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: engprof
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and the rooftop breakfast is delightful. The front desk staff always looked annoyed to be consulted and we did not get an early morning wake-up call--lucky we woke up on our own. Staff needs an attitude adjustment, please

Reviews.Title: “Special!!”
Reviews.Author: iurikolkoff
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel!Perfect new rooms, great location and special staff(helpful and friendly). Loved everything, got rooms on the 2nd floor, marble bathrooms, luxury furnitures. Excellent rich buffet breakfast on the upper floor. We go often to Rome, we found the right hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: spiceygreeneyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Aug 2010, in one of the old rooms which was not renovated, bathroom was dirty, room very small, could barely fit in the baggage, on the side of the bed, if my husband was standing i had to lie in bed. After coming back from our trip to another city we stayed for one more night in this hotel and we got a newly renovated room, which was a bit bigger than the previous one and a lot more cleaner. Ask for the newly renovated rooms and you'll be fine. And don't try to sleep in the afternoon because it's a lot of noise from the renovations going on in the hotel. This hotel is close to the Colosseum, Plaza Venezia, Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “A tremendous value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: robmazz
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel in July. We booked the room for 5 and found it quite spacious, clean with good air conditioning.Amedeo and his staff were particularly helpful to us never leading us astray with their recommendations for food and other leisure activities. The hotel was clean and it's location superb with many local stores within walking distance to cater to any of your needs. Breakfast on the roof in the morning was very good. Staff was courteous and always willing to help. I have been to Italy almost 20 times and have stayed in my share of hotels. I would put this with the best as far as value especially considering that Rome is a large city. When I return to rome I will return to the Borromeo.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: a_di0de
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Borromeo is a quaint little place about a 20 minute walk from the Coliseum. It’s greatest attribute is that it is reasonably priced for the location. We spent 3 nights here and were pleased with what we got for the price. We stayed on the second floor in room 201, which was on the back side of the building. It was pretty quiet and the only noises we heard were that of the other guests when they were in the hallway. The room had the standard amenities, towel service, TV, wake up call, etc. All in all a decent value for the money. The good: - A short walk from the Roma Termini station (500 Meters), and an even shorter walk to the Cavour station. - Nice trim in rooms; somewhat luxurious feel (wood trim, high ceilings, marble flooring, etc.) - Breakfast included; much better than your standard continental breakfast, as there was scrambled eggs, ham, numerous pastries and cereals available. - LCD TV in room with a lot of stations, some of which you can change the language to English. (I doubt you’ll spend much time watching TV though, you are in Rome after all.) - English speaking staff. - Safe in room. The Bad: - Rooms are quite small; very limited space in main area. - No bathtub, only a medium sized shower, which unfortunately did not drain very well. - No alarm clock in room. The so-so: - The hotel sits above the subway line, so you do hear and feel the rumble of the subway, however it is not so bad. Bonus: - Across the street is a pizzeria named “Robin Hood.” If you stay here, do your self a favor and have dinner there, it’s amazing. Order the special and you won’t be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location with a breakfast to match”
Reviews.Author: unclewallyhenniker
Reviews.Content: Recently we had the opportunity to spend five nights at Hotel Borromeo. It is ideally located, just far enough away from the Termini and quite near to the Roman Forum and Colleseum...perfect for a nightly stroll to take in the lights of ancient Rome. Even a Metro stop was just down the road. We couldn't have asked for a better location. Wheeling our luggage from the Termini to hotel was effortless. Although the lobby is a bit small with an elevator to match, however, giving the place some charm, the updated room was exceptionally spacious and clean with a decor that was warm and pleasing: white marble floors, soft painted walls and comfortable beds. The bathroom, too, was recently updated and had a shower to die for. Our room overlooked the busy Via Cavor, yet the double glassed windows and shutters kept out the sounds of a busy life outside. We were quite comfortable in our temporary dwelling. The breakfast was exceptional. It was a full breakfast with bacon, eggs, cold meats, a variety of breads and sweet rolls, cereal and more. If you ate late, you wouldn't need to spend further money on lunch. The hotel staff at the reception desk were very helpful in answering any of our questions. They also spoke some English...some more fluent than others. Overall, our stay was a delightful one and would definitely return. Two experienced travelers from the States.

Reviews.Title: “we can advise this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SainrPetersburgMaria
Reviews.Content: we can advise this hotel because the rooms are very new and nice. Service is very polite. And the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: mizunoman
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Borromeo Hotel, and they have really improved it in the last two years. Our room and bathroom had been recently updated with new tile floors, furniture , bathroom tile and fixtures. A very nice surprise. We had a room with a queen bed and the room was very large. The price is great and the location is excellent. If you arrive in Rome by train, the station is around a ten minute walk from the hotel so that is great. It is a short walk to the Forum area. There are many great restaurants all up and down the Via Cavour. The breakfast is included in the price of the room and it is more than adequate. The staff is very helpful. If you want a very nice hotel in Rome and a great price, you should give this a try.

Reviews.Title: “Positive feedback”
Reviews.Author: Matrix2000
Reviews.Content: We stay in May 2010 in this hotel and were positively surprised. Bathroom is brand new and the breakfast room is pleasant, located on the top floor of the hotel. We just struggled with the shower since you have no place to put the gel or the soap. Location is good, close to the station and the Coliseum. A bit expensive, but its Rome..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I had a pleasant one week stay at Hotel Borromeo in April 2010. We liked both the hotel and its location very much. We were given a good size room with high ceiling on the second floor, with two separate beds, marble top night tables, a desk, flat-screen TV (with 100s of channels, including Russian, Polish, Chinese..), a minibar that was more of a mini fridge (with a choice of drinks and a couple of empty shelves). Closet had many hangers and there was an easy to use in-room safe. We liked the old world decor and custom made wooden furniture. I picked this hotel for its convenient location and reasonable price and we were quite happy with the choice. It is steps away from Cavour metro station, very close to the Colosseum and the Roman Forums, with some charming old streets nearby: via del Cardello, via Leonina, via Madonna dei Monti with its restaurants, and more. Termini Station is within walking distance (about 10-15 minutes). From/to Fiumicino airport to Termini we took the "sit bus shuttle", paid 15 Euros for 2-way fare (one-way fare is 8 Euros), its stop is right outside Terminal 3. The included breakfast was quite ordinary, although there was enough choice, we would have preferred quality over quantity. There were cereals, rolls, jams, etc and a few hot items: fried bacon, hard boiled and scrambled eggs. Fresh fruit consisted of sad looking, withering apples and oranges. Renovation works were still on but that did not bother us. A couple of times, when we dropped by during the day, there was a bit of noise and that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Premium location, updating interior”
Reviews.Author: patentmaniac
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hotel Borromeo in April and had a great experience. Yes, they are remodeling and the workers come in around 8:30AM and leave around 5PM and this causes some noise. My single room was above average for most single rooms that I have stayed in with the exception of the bathroom which was just average. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room has a small television with about 200 channels. The walls are thin, but most of the occupants were aware of this and everyone stayed very quiet. The staff were very friend and helpful with directions and recommendations. The best part about the stay is the location, with so many great things to see close by. I especially like the location because it is near great shopping and restaurants down streets that locals haunt and it is close to all of the sights the Colloseum area, the Parthenon, many local basilicas and churchs. Via Cavour is the street to be on, and luckily that is where the Borromeo hotel stands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good value and in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: dbucko
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights when we first arrived in Rome. We didn't know the city and I was hoping this would be a good spot to stay - The hotel was perfect, clean, good bathroom facilities and the location was fantastic. I could only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovating Hotel, Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: CADuck
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to Borromeo Hotel, the staff was very helpful and got us to our room quickly. After that, things went down hill. The staircase looked dirty and in poor condition. When we got to our room, and used the bathroom, the toilet would not stop running. We were then told it was a problem with the chains inside the wall and it would not be taken care of until the following day. We requested a new room and we were promptly given one, a floor above. This is when we discovered that the hotel is undergoing renovations. Our new room was better than the first, but the ventilation system was not working properly, and sleeping with the window open was out of the question because our room overlooked a very busy street. The location of the hotel is perfect, about five minutes walking distance from the Colosseum, and a decent but easy walk to other sights. There is a metro station close by and the Roma Termini is about five minutes away. We did not spend much time in the hotel, partly because of all there is to see in Rome, and partly because they do all the renovations during the day. The breakfast was ok, nothing special. If you want to use the wi-fi. you have to pay, same with 90% of the tv channels, which made finding the news or weather difficult. However, the driver they contract with was excellent. We had an early flight out of Fiumicino, and he was there at 5 am on the dot. He was very nice, and got us to the airport in a timely manner. Maybe things will be better at the Borromeo once the renovations are done, but as of right now, I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: adriancanada
Reviews.Content: Travelling around Italy with my wife for a long journey in Europe we arrived in Rome late at night by car and we found this Hotel beetwen others in the area of the Colosseum. We got a good rate for a standard dbl room with breakfast and we decided to stay. We spent 4 days in Rome. We liked the Hotel very much, and we appreciated the way we were welcomed from the staff. The room was large enough and recently refurbished with a nice marble bathroom. We had a standard room but all was available;minibar, Sat Tv(lots of English channels),individual heat,safe etc. The breakfast room was on the top floor and it was also renovated. The breakfast was good and various enough for all needings. Th hotel location is excellent, few mns. from the Colosseum and all the ancient Rome. It was the first time in Rome, and we found it very beautiful and interesting. We walked a lot and despite the cold weather(but we are from Canada!!!,so no problem..) it was nice to discover the narrow streets and small corners of Rome, breathing the ancient atmosphere of this city. It was a nice trip, and thanks also to Borromeo, we already decided to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: KJSG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conviniently situated between Colloseum/Fourm and the train station, which are both within walking distance and close to the Cavour metro station. The rooms are a little small, but nicely decorated and in nice condition. The hotel serves a pretty comprehensive continental breakfast which kept us happy for our 9 days' stay. All in all excellent location and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: stylli24
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks really nice and definetely is really nice!! I booked through their website and i get a lower rate than all others website. Rooms big and well conditioned, new fornitures and clean every day. The cleaner Maria makes our stay really comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, fresh rolls, fresh croissant, hoem made cake every day, yogurt, different choice of cheese and ham and fresh fruit every days from owner country. Special thanks to the staff at reception. We lost our luggage at the airport but the man at reception, called Amodio, helps us to get it on same day....thanks Amodio. Definetely recommendable hotel for a good price compared with location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: evagorova
Reviews.Content: I use to travel a lot to Rome for my business and pleasure and this time a friend of mine living in Rome booked this hotel on Via Cavour next to the Colosseum. Normally we use to stay in 4 stars hotels but we found this hotel nice and very nice. The service is excellent as well as the staff and all in general is well kept. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor, and they were new, bright and extremely clean. We loved the terrace next to ourt rooms and despite the weather(it was cold in that period!) we spent a lil time there having a drink. Lovely area next to the Colosseum and the roman Forums, plenty of restaurants and close to Via nazionale for shopping. A pleasant journey in Rome, we will be back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: jackturid
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in the city centre. Booked through the homesite i ve found a great rate. The hotel is very clean and located close to the Colosseum. Been there for 3 days.I ll surealy will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: Behar1124
Reviews.Content: Maybe we got treated unfairly because we were a bunch of college students, forced to stay the night in Rome to catch a flight out to Berlin the next morning, and were tired and grumpy, but I find it frustrating when I think to myself that we would have been treated differently if our parents had been there with us. There was no respect between the man behind the counter and us. He talked to us like we were children, and was not helpful at ALL. When we asked about a good place to grab pizza, he told us about the place across the street. When I asked him about pasta, he looked at me like I was crazy. One of my friends asked for an extra pillow since hers was practically nonexistent. It took over a half hour for him to bring it up to our room. I would not stay there again simply on the principal of how disrespectful the employee was. My friend bought internet for 2 Euro at night, and the next morning when we were handing in our key, the man said she needed to pay. She had already paid with the other man last night, and the man insisted on calling his colleague to make sure she was telling the truth. Out of frustration and the need to leave, she just paid again.

Reviews.Title: “hey this is a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: fellen
Reviews.Content: Hotel perfectly situated in the historic area of Rome next to the Colosseum. We stayed there 5 nights. Hotel clean and nice, rich breakfast on the roof. Despite it was October it was very hot and the aircon worked properly. Nice area at night, lots of little restaurants and bars. Metro Station is 2 blocks far so perfect to start the discover of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Been here with friends”
Reviews.Author: hellenmark
Reviews.Content: Lovely!! Very clean and excellent staff. Rooms large and very new. Great breakfast on the top floor. Been here with friends in October. Reccomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Anja-Superlekker
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute on strength of price and online reviews, and this little simple hotel has all you need, right int he centre of Rome, We had a small but quiet en-suite room, spotless clean and comfortable, with a littel marble bathroom. Since we did not spend much time in it, size was never an issue. Can walk easily from train station to hotel and from there to all city centre sights. The only disappointment was the breakfast, especially the disgusting coffee from an urn. However, when there are plenty of wonderful cafes right next to the hotel, who's to complain?

Reviews.Title: “I like it!”
Reviews.Author: valentinazayasheva
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel! Been here with friends in October, just few days ago.We were a group of friends from Russia and we all had the same feeling with the Hotel Borromeo! Excellent staff, clena large rooms, great breakfast. The price we paid was reasonable comparing to other hotels, and we surely have chosen the right hotel. Rome is wonderful, we had lots of fun, we have been in several discos and clubs, small but nice. Do not miss Spaghetti alla Carbonara,mmmmm, delicious. Thanks Rome, thanks Borromeo!!

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: putinazechova
Reviews.Content: That is what I consider a nice hotel! excellent location, next to the Colosseum and Roman Forums. Very clean rooms, with a great marble bathroom and a full working shower. We have been here for 4 nights, we found it trough a friend of ours who was here few monts ago. The staff was very warm and helpful(we felt teh Italian way!) We often travel to Rome, we think this was the best hotel we have been until now. Already planned another trip in December, surely we will stay here again. Do not miss the little restaurants around the hotel, the real italian cuisine..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: troopbanter
Reviews.Content: A small, pleasant hotel in very central location, within walking distance of the principal Roman archeological sites. We had a small, slightly cramped but comfrtable room, with excellent shower/bath, on the second floor at the back of the hotel. No view, but also no noise. There is a good Continental breakfast on the enclosed roof terrace. Although there is no resaurant there are some very good, inexpensive restaurants in the same street as the hotel, and others within easy walking distance. The staff speak English and are most friendly and very helpful. They gave us a good recommendation for a local restaurant. An ideal hotel for a short stay in Rome. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel in a Great Position”
Reviews.Author: LandyTripAfrica
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Borromeo. We had a small room on the 2nd floor with a decent bathroom and a large comfortable bed. Everything worked and the shower was great. The staff were very helpful and all spoke English. For the price, we thought it was good value, as the position, equidistant from the station and the coliseum is excellent. We walked everywhere, even at night, and never felt unsafe. The street is friendly with little shops selling everything you might need and some excellent restaurants. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DeLollisFrank
Reviews.Content: I live in italy because of family reasons and this was the first time in Rome. Like everyone in the world I was so excited to visit Rome with my family. We decided finally to go to Rome. What a splendid city, so crowded! but....so lovely. We stayed at the Borromeo Hotel for 4 nights and we had 2 rooms on the first floor(110-111). They were spacious enough and very well decorated.Unfortunately no coffee/tea maker in the room(but this seems to be normal in Italy), but 24h service in the room, so this was not a problem at all. The aircon system was excellent, it was so hot in Rome you cannot imagine! On the 3rd floor there is the breakfast room, large enough not to wait for a free table.Good selection of food. We walked all over Rome, we visited the most important sites like the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and The Colosseum.OH! what a marvellous thing is the Colosseum, impressive!!! We surely had great food during our stay, we loved the Fettuccini Primavera(ham,cream,tomato). Through the Hotel reception (always helpful and kind) we also booked a daily trip with guide to Tivoli, a lovely ancient site near rome, famous for fountains and gardens. My children loved Rome and they already told me they want to come back soon:) Thanks Borromeo, it helped us to make our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but cramped”
Reviews.Author: strawberry131
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights last week and the location of this hotel was excellent, about 10 minutes to Termini station and also to the Colosseum. However, if you are looking for a spacious/luxious room to relax in after all the sight seeing; be warned! The room was absolutely tiny, just about cramming in a double bed. The shower was also incredibly small and I kept hitting my elbows on the walls trying to wash myself! For anyone not too worried about size i would recommend this hotel. Our room was for two people in a double bed. Some other rooms which we walked past that were open while the maid was cleaning appeared to be quite a lot bigger, perhaps being for 3 people or more. We could not hear the traffic outside, although the metro which seems to run underneath the hotel was very loud (and we were on the first floor). There were also some noisy people slamming doors and chatting loudly in corridors very late at night. The breakfast was very nice, with plenty to choose from to suit all kinds of tastes. Overall, the accomodation was very pleasant but a bit too cramped.

Reviews.Title: “perfect long stay”
Reviews.Author: vegoreva
Reviews.Content: I moved from Russia(Moscow) to live in rome for business reasons. I was reserved from my company for a 14 days in the Hotel Borromeo (where I already was once in a previous holiday in Rome), and then I moved in an flat near the Colosseum where I actually live. The Hotel was again perfect for my long stay. Because of business reasons I appreciated the fast Internet wifi connection: I used to sit on the terrace on the 3rd floor and work with my laptop drinking something and keeping a lil of sun!!:) The staff is gentle and I asked for a room on the back of the Hotel. The A/C was excellent and the cleaning was daily done. It was really hard to work in Rome on these sunny days even if on weekends I took a pause and I went to Ostia(the sea of Rome) on the beach. It's easy to reach it from the Hotel, just take metro to the stop Ostiense and then the direct train to Ostia. Before Ostia there is a site call Ostia antica, where you can see the ruins of ancient romans. It's a must, go there once if can! Now I live in rome and I got my flat, and sometimes I pass by the Hotel to say Privet!(hallo in English!) to the guys at the reception and they are always friendly and offer a cup of coffee to me!

Reviews.Title: “thanks Borromeo”
Reviews.Author: borceric
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well located and excellent service. Made our stay in Rome perfect. We'll surely use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Evgeenia
Reviews.Content: We have spent a long weekend in Rome few months ago and despite the bad weather we found we had a lovely romantic trip. Rome is one of our favourite destionation in the world and we love to walk and discover everytime new things in this incredible city. We slept in the Hotel Borromeo for 3 nights and we found it very confortable and well located. The front desk is very helpful and we felt like home. We had a room in the front on a very busy street but thanks to the double window we did not have any problem with noise.....(anyway, Rome is a big city like Budapest, what can you expect!!?).... We went to different restaurants, ask the concierge if you need to book one. Rome is fantastic.......!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandr69
Reviews.Content: We would like to recomend this hotel for the good quality that has shown us. We spent a cool week in Rome helped by the receptionists and people working there. Thank you for your help. Aleksandr Cifarieliov

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: alexevich
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay in the Hotel Borromeo, together with my family. The room was large enough for the 4 of us and very quiet. We loved the area of the Hotel, close to the most important sites. A small nice hotel, clean and very well keeped.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place! Perfect location for your Roman adventures!”
Reviews.Author: Adventuresbyme
Reviews.Content: I will always remember the Borromeo Hotel as this was my first time in Italy! I'm soooo glad I decided to book this hotel. It has a small-hotel charm to it. The location is SUPERB! You're in the middle of everything...Termini Station is very close...we walked to the hotel. The major sights, like the Coloseum and the Foro Romano are all within walking distance. There are various restaurants and small grocery-type stores within a few steps. The location is vey safe. Transportation wise, it's easy to get to either walking of via the metro line which is a few blocks away. I found that in most of of Italy, there aren't too many facilies that offer accomodating services for someone in a wheelchair or other type of needs, especially in the subway/metro areas. The stairs in the hotel are a little steep and the elevator is small, along with the shower. If someone is looking for handicapped facilites, please be sure to ask any hotel if they can accomodate your needs. The room is a bit small but it's fine as you spent most of your day sight seeing. (If you have more than 1 child the room would be too small.) The staff was very nice. There is NOTHING negative I can say about this hotel. I would truly recommend it to anyone. Absolutely loved it! Grazie, Hotel Borromeo!! Via Cavourrrrr!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for budget travelling”
Reviews.Author: meelg
Reviews.Content: A nice 3 star hotel, close to the antiquity era ruins (forum, colusseum, etc.) but further from the vatican, piazza navona, trevi fountain, pantheon. There's a subway station 2 minutes walk from the hotel (b line) which is very convenient. Rooms: quite small, safe included, tv, fridge, nicely decorated. Bathroom: Shower, clean, fresh amenities every day. everything worked and was kept clean. Breakfast: quite good, on rooftop patio, pastries, cereal, spreads, etc. Neighborhood: Nice, clean, no homeless people, nice bar up the street (the druid's bar I think it was called) for tourists. The only bad thing I can say about it was that the b line goes pretty much underneath the hotel and can be annoying, but we didn't overly suffer. Also, there was only hot airconditioning at the time, not cold.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever. And smelly...”
Reviews.Author: TLV-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Reading here that the room in the Borromeo are even small in European standards didn't make me change my mind about the booking. Why should I care? This is rome, and I would probably be spending the entire day outside, just spending a few hours in the room for sleeping what I come back after a day of shopping... Boy, was I wrong. This hotel is too small and claustrophobic. The double bed (which isn't the biggest or the most comfortable thing either) takes up literally the entire room. There is no place to put your luggage (2 medium size suitcases), let alone unpacking them (small cupboard with room for a few t-shirts, and a jacket).
