To get to the bed we had to jump over the suitcases, that were standing against the room's door. To change clothes, we had to go the small bathroom. And the smell in the room - it stunk from cigarette smoking, and had just a bad sweaty odor. If you want to enjoy your vacation - do not go here! I paid a 100/Euros per night, for 4 nights, and though this was a bargain deal. It wasn't. We didn't want to come back to our hotel in the evening, fearing that we would get too depressed... If I had to plan my trip again, I would book a different hotel, maybe further from the center of the city, but with a bit more elbowroom.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely nice”
Reviews.Author: adelbaleb
Reviews.Content: Often I travel to Italy in this period of the year(April), and evrytime we spend 2 or 3 nights in Rome before going to Tuscany and before take the flight back to Sharm where we live. A friend of mine suggested me this hotel in Rome. We have found it very nice and very convenient. We booked 3 dbl rooms and at the check in we had 3 rooms on the same floor next to each other. Nice rooms, good breakfast on a roof on 3rd floor. The hotel is located in a very central area of Rome and the concierge at the hotel suggested us also a very nice arabian restaurant and it was very appeciated! We loved to walk to the Roman Forums and the Colisseum and we also reserved through the Hotel a one day excursion to Naples. We had a very good impression of the Hotel and the staff, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent value, BEWARE: not for families w/ more than 1 child”
Reviews.Author: ObviousMan
Reviews.Content: I want to start saying that hotel is quite decent for the money, even has an elevator (lift). Rooms are clean, serviced early, OK breakfast, free WiFi. The rest is FYI. We had a hard time finding quad room for the recent trip to Rome. From hotels with decent reviews at good location very few even had them, that's why we settled on Borromeo. We came in before the room was ready, so we went sightseeing and came back near 9pm completely spent. When we went into our room we found out that instead of a quad room it was a double room where they managed to cram 2 more beds. Under cram I mean there was barely space to get into a cabinet and about that much to get into the bathroom. One of the roll aways was next to a double bed, and the other was at the foot of the other beds. You had to actually crawl over one bed to get to another. So much for European fire safety code. Do not get me wrong, I've been to enough hotels in Europe to not expect much in terms of space. This was not a quad room by any mean. We tried to catch a manager the next day but could not. I complained to the duty guy. The next day (for the 3rd night) we came back to find out that all of our stuff was moved into a larger room they called suite. I found the manager the next day and he said the first room was that we booked, and then they "upgraded" us for free. Still trying to resolve with Expedia, since the whole thing was prepaid. One more thing is street noise is quite prominent on the side facing Via Cavour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Doches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March, 2009. This is a very nice hotel and is in a great location. It is only a few blocks from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. It is on a busy street and is a little noisy but not bad. The staff are very helpful and the breakfast is good. The hotel also has a wonderful upstairs terrace with wi-fi access. There are restaurants nearby as well as bus stops and a metro stop (Cavour). We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: nvorov
Reviews.Content: good location excellent staff lovely rooms.no bad coments, a good nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander1973
Reviews.Content: I ve been in Rome for 3 nights in this lovely Hotel with my family. We had 2 rooms on the first floor. Great rooms, large and very clean. Excellent staff, very helpful with our requests. Location is also excellent, close to the Roman Forums and Colosseum. We loved to walk around and discover the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel - but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JulieStevenage_Herts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money with a reasonable breakfast, but the rooms are small. Hotel Borromeo is central for Colosseum and other cultural sites, for the metro (though beware that you can hear / feel the metro trains from within your room) and for restaurants / bars. Staff are friendly, we were able to leave our luggage on both our first day prior to checking in and on the last day. We didn't use the bar as there is no where to sit down. There is a mini bar, though no prices available. However my son had a couple of bottles of water which were just a euro each. All in all, with current pound / euro issues this is good value and central. It is just that the area around the bed was small and we had no kind of view. It was however clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: vixisabel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Borromeo Hotel earlier this week for 3 nights. The staff were very helpful, and allowed me to check in at 11:00am- which was incredibly useful. As I was travelling by myself I wanted to be somewhere safe, and I felt safe at the Borromeo. The room was secure and the location didn't make me feel nervous. The room was obviously on the small side... standard Rome size! The room was well equipped, clean, comfortable. The bathroom was great - toilet, bidet, huge sink and mirror; the shower in the bath could have been unsuitable if I was taller- although it was fine for me! Towels were changed everyday. The only downsides was being able to hear the metro rumbling underneath when lying in bed, and I couldn't pick wifi up in my room on the 1st floor. Breakfast was good, pastries, cereal, yogurt, bread... etc... although I have to say that the coffee didn't taste especially like coffee. But when you know that you're going to be surrounded by coffee all day, it doesn't matter that much.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: JagerCostaRica
Reviews.Content: I and a friend of mine stayed three nights in this hotel while visiting Rome. While located very near to the Colisseum and Train Terminal, I would rate this hotel to be slightly below average. There were various problems with both rooms. Neither one of us was able to adjust the heating system and had to open windows to keep the rooms bearable. The rooms were average in cleanliness and size. There were various other minor problems that would only require a minimum amount of maintenance to have the rooms up to par. The problem with this hotel is that management does not seem to keep up with maintenance in the facility. The rate of the hotel is not an actual bargain but is slightly high. The room rate includes breakfast, but the breakfast offered is of very low quality. The bottom line is that the rate for the quality of this hotel is more that what it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Very much enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: GW72
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to both the historical center and Termini station -- 10 minutes on foot or a quick ride on the bus, which stops right outside the hotel. Rooms are smallish but very clean and well-appointed, with marble sink, wood parquet and inlaid marble floors. A full breakfast is provided (cappuccino is available on request, at no extra charge). Desk staff was very friendly, helping with directions and meal suggestions, and even allowed us to store our luggage for a while after checkout time. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “quite adequate”
Reviews.Author: JoanB811
Reviews.Content: We hadn't planned on staying at the Borromeo when we arrived in Rome, in fact, we hadn't booked a hotel at all. We made our way from the airport to Termini station to the internet cafe. We found the Borromeo and basically, it was around the corner and a short walk. We arrived with no reservation, my boyfriend explained he saw a rate on a website and they honored the price we saw. They did not have to do that. We found the location PERFECTO! After a few days there, we felt like we belonged in the neighborhood, people would wave to us as we walked by shops, restaraunts, ect. The room was just the right size, we were in 110. The room overlooked the street. If you want quiet, get out of the city or book a 5 star hotel. When I'm in a new city I want to hear, see, smell and touch everything. When the double windows were closed we had complete silence. I've stayed at more expensive hotels in London and Paris that were shoe boxes. As far as European 3 star hotels go, this one was perfect. People complained about breakfast. Personally, I didn't go to Rome for bacon and eggs. Sure, the food wasn't great but it was a great start to the day. Croissants, bread for toast, rolls, cereal, coffee or tea. It was perfectly fine. When in Rome,,,,,,,,,,,and Italians don't eat big breakfasts. To all the naysayers, if you expect the Ritz, pay for it! Thank You Borromea, I'll stay again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Borromeo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annatsurik
Reviews.Content: It's a 3star stilysh hotel next to the Colosseum.With good service and renewed rooms. I and my friends enjoyed with tasty breakfasts on the terrase where we also could use high speed internet all around the day. No doubts Hotel Borromeo is a nice place to stay during your roman holidays!

Reviews.Title: “happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ykalinki
Reviews.Content: Some friends of mine suggested me to reserve this Hotel in rome. I use to go to Italy for business reasons, especially rome and Milan. During my business trip I love also to visit the places so when I choose a Hotel, I always try to find something central. Thos Hotel was a good surprise. It is a smal, lovely hotel in the city centre, close to a metro station(useful for me to reach my business points) and very close to the Colosseum and the shopping area. The room was nice and large, clean as all the hotel. The hotel has a free wi-fi connection, which is extremely important for me as I need to use my pc often when I am in the Hotel. I ve been there for 3 nights, and I ve already reserved my next stay for December! It was a nice surprise discover that the manager talk a lil russian, I felt like home:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CathieGPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Borromeo, Rome in September of 2008. We very much enjoyed the small 30 room hotel with great location along with being conveniently near the metro, train station, taxi stand, ATM and plenty of shops and restaurants. It was clean, had a nice size room and bath. Included a king size bed, safe, mini bar and breakfast buffet. Sergio at the front desk was always cheerful and helpful in assiting with our needs. We would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: adelkazai
Reviews.Content: Before flying to S.Africa for a long vacation we decided to stop for 3 days in Rome and booked this hotel. It is centrally located walking from the colisseum and the Roman Forums. We arrived early in the morning and even if the check in was at 2pm the room was ready at 11am, thanks God, we were really tired! We got a room on the 2nd floor, we liked it, spacious, confortable and very very clean. We spent 3 days in Rome, we love this city, so warm, even if like all the big capitals in the world lots of traffic!!! Breakfast in the hotel was served on 3rd floor, and thanks to the lovely weather we had the chance to seat outside the roof garden, in a lovely small open terrace.Eggs, pastries, fruits, juices and son on made our mornings perfect. Surely this is the Hotel where we will be back when in Rome. P.S. 5 mns. from the Hotel there is a little, delicious restaurant...ask the reception the name...I can't remind it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tricia79
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they advised us there was a couple with a sick baby in our room that could not depart and we would be moved for the night to their sister hotel, Hotel Bolivar, a four-star. The room at the Bolivar was disgusting (see seperate review). I called the Borromeo the next morning to complain about the conditions and hoped their accomodations would be better. They assured me it would be but as I expected, they were not! The room they gave us was a suite that most likely had not been renovated since 1960. There were exposed electrical wires at the top of the shower and the shower head was caked with mildew. There was a hole in the bathroom door, as though someone rammed it with a broomstick. The noise from the street polluted our room (we had no shutters) and the room shook every time a metro went by!!! I asked if they had better accomodations available and they put us in another room on the third floor, which seemed a bit better, but after seeing the roaches I was absolutely repulsed! This really put a damper on our stay in Rome. The location wasn't so great either. Do Not Stay Here

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, passable at best.”
Reviews.Author: AverageJoeUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick two nighter in Rome here, pre booked through Expedia. Paid around £270 for two nights assuming the hotel would be nice and clean. Sadly disappointed. The listed FULL BREAKFAST is anything but. It's free juice in plastic cups with some pastries and cereals. No sign of anything approaching a buffet or full breakfast. You could buy your own, better, from the supermarket for a few Euro per person. On our first night we were given "the flat" ( "no extra charge - you stay there it's good!" apparently ) If this is given to you, do not go in. It's a large flat that opens onto the main street that shows signs of being broken into before. Door very unsecure and marked, room is very very noisy. If it's not the street, it's the metro line directly underneath. Imagine mini earthquakes every ten minutes. There's also a boiler sound in the room which will give the impression it's tipping it down outside, when actually it's not. General condition of room is well used, but OK in terms of cleanliness. Old toothpaste on the plastic of the cup wrappers and a spot of blood on an unused sanitary towel bag... We were moved for our second night to a far superior room in the hotel proper. This was very clean and much much better. Linen fresh and clean, room condition good. Only complaint would be the lingering smell of cigarette smoke drifting down the coridoor, and the fact the windowsill looked like it had been used as an ashtray years ago. Staff very very courteous and good though. Definitely the hotels strong point. Pro's: decent location, good staff, helpful, main rooms clean and tidy. Con's : Flat room is a dump, hotel built over subway line, breakfast is the bare essentials. Very overpriced rates.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katerina2006
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe some of these recent reviews are for the same hotel we stayed in!!! In my view the Hotel Borromeo was reasonably priced (for Rome!), clean, comfortable, in a fantastic location and perfect for a short city break. Firstly it is on a very busy street but the rooms have shutters and a double window which blocks out ALL the street noise when shut. The buzz of the street, in my view, adds to the charm of the hotel. We loved peering out of our window and watching the world go by - it is right in the middle of the 'life' of the city - Rome is a capital city - expect noise! Secondly it was 30 degrees when we were there - the air conditioning worked perfectly and we were more than comfortable in the day and night. Thirdly the rooms are not massive but rooms in hotels in Europe never are unless you want to pay £500 per night!! The rooms in the Borromeo were certainly bigger than I was expecting. The staff were more than friendly and helpful and I know they appreciated my attempt at speaking Italian - however poor!! To sum up, I think the Borromeo is a great find for a short city break, for the money we paid I was more than happy!

Reviews.Title: “Neglected hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoofboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here for our 1st wedding anniversary and first time in Rome, the web site looked great, ignore it, it`s totally unlike anything you`ll see in the hotel. The fresh flowers that are shown everywhere don`t exist, you may see the plastic ones on the roof terrace that look like they`ve been pulled from the river Tiber. The breakfast room was not a nice well kept room, it was a dirty terrace on the roof that served brown tasteless water that was supposed to be coffee, orange squash not juice, stale bread, well sweated cooked meats that looked like they`d been there all night. Dirty utensills, plastic cups.Unironed dirty tablecloths with food remnants from previous days breakfast on them. The staff were picking at the breakfast ,but the tipping dish that was present, surely a joke. The room was very small and filthy, scuff marks all over the walls, it looked like a D.S.S. bed sit although the sheets were changed daily. The shower head was full of limescale so the water shot out in all directions, the toilet seat was cracked and pinched your bottom every time it was sat on. The glasses in the room were plastic, scratched and cloudy, disposable plastic cups in the bathroom. Smelled of smoke everywhere, as non smokers this was a big disapointment. I would be ashamed to take paying guests if this was my hotel. Little money was needed to change the circumstances in this hotel, a coat of paint in the rooms, basic maintenance in the bathrooms and a breakfast that didn`t seem like it had been put together for under one euro per person. The worst hotel we`ve ever stayed at!!

Reviews.Title: “Big dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: trippingirl53
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Borromeo in Rome at the end of a 12 day Eastern Mediterranean Cruise. We were immediately disappointed by the shabby lobby. We had to wait three hours for our rooms, with no where to sit but one wobbly settee. We were even more disappointed when we saw the tiny rooms. The rooms were hot, and stuffy. Some of us were one floor up from the busy street, and when we opened the window for air, we got fumes and noise. Those in our party who had inside rooms had to contend with construction noises from early in the morning. This we might have expected in the middle of Rome, but we didn't expect terrible mattresses, pillows flat and hard, and no where to sit in the rooms except wobbly straight back chairs......(if you were fortunate enough to have a chair in your room.) Some of the staff was very rude. We had a lousy breakfast with fake orange "punch", cold scrambled eggs, and cold cereal that was left out all night uncovered in bowls. The elevator was very dicey, and the winding stairs narrow, steep and scary, with a rope railing only on one small section. The place was shabby, in need of paint, and boarded up in places. The buzz of the "breakfast room" was how disappointed everyone was in the place. We will never stay there again, and we'll spread the word. It was much too expensive for what it was, a dive. There was only one of three men working there who was any help at all when we asked questions, I was so grateful for that one helpful person, that in spite of my disappointment in the place, I gave him a nice tip. It was obvious to us that the owners of the place have no regard for their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller007
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 magical nights in Venice, my husband and I made our way to Rome where we had booked to stay at this hotel for 4 nights. Firstly the hotel desk clerk was not very friendly. When we entered our room I was most shocked. The walls were so dirty. The floors were dusty. I got even more depressed when I entered the bath area. The marble tops had white streak marks. I was most disgusted. The bath is very narrow and I don't know how a big sized person can manage here. They only leave two bath towels every day, and I was so irritated because all the fluff from the towel remains on you after using it. Our toilet would not flush and when I told the desk clerk he sent up the same guy who helped us with our bags, who tried to do something, but could not fix the toilet. We spent the rest of our stay with a faulty toilet. The plastic cups for water were stained. I felt like running out of this room after enduring all these nasty experiences. Unfortunately my husband had paid up front through hotels.com so we could not leave this hotel. The breakfast utensils had disgusting stains on them. The only thing bearable about this hotel was the coffee. The location is convenient but the hotel is very noisy. You can hear the next door guests, plus the trains running underground create horrible vibrations which are most disturbing at night. I think this hotel is trying to save on costs and hence create a most uncomfortable stay for guests. We paid almost 200 euros per night and felt very cheated. My husband and I felt like our first trip to Rome was tarnished by our stay at this hotel. Please do yourself a big favour and do not ever stay at this hotel. I absolutely cannot believe that people have positive things to say about this hotel. As my husband says, they should change the name of the hotel from Hotel Borromeo to Hotel Horrormeo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamaree
Reviews.Content: it could have been a better stay if the elevator was working. I don't know when they plan of fixing it but the wires were hanging of the elevator and in the 3 days i stayed there I never saw anyone working on it. the cleaning staff leaves their cleaing carts and towels and supplies in the hallways against the wall so its an eyesore but besides that, the hotel was a decent stay. its a short walk to the metro and the colisieum. The guy who works at the front desk in the evening is very helpful but avoid the jerk who works there in the morning. he's no help at all. they were kind to give us a suite on our first day there, then changed us to the room we originally booked the 2nd day. I might try another hotel next time i'm in Rome but wouldn't mind staying here agian.

Reviews.Title: “a nice place”
Reviews.Author: jpnc
Reviews.Content: I reserved this little hotel for my first trip in Rome and I am totally satisfied of my choice. After a very long trip to Europe there was a limo reserved from the hotel to wait for us at the airport. After a 40 mns. drive we arrived at the Hotel which is located right near the Colisseum. A very friendly person at the check in welcomed us (his name is Sergio) and we got room n.205 on the 2nd floor. Big enough with a nice bathroom and nice fornitures. Next morning we liked the breakfast served on the 3rd floor on a spacious roof terrace. More, they got a free internet access, I found it very convenient. We walked a lot during our stay in Rome, we enjoyed this city, so crowded (like all big cities) but just...fantastic.We were surrounding by history! I liked my stay in Rome, I liked the Hotel, I love this city!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Borromeo”
Reviews.Author: Juliushengelo
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through a travel agency for a five day trip with the family to Rome. First reception was very pleasant and staff was very helpful to make sure we had good rooms. Although rooms were on the street side we had no problems with traffic noise due to excellent isolation (double windows) . Beds were okay and the bathroom adequate although the shower was not too big. Breakfast was simple but effective. The hotel is situated close (walking distance) to most historic sites like Colloseum, Trevi and shopping areas. Good rstaurants nearby and on walking distance of Central station Termini. Metro is close too. Staff was very helpful and gave good support. Four nights at the Borromeo gave us a great holiday and we would not hesitate going back there.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mark400
Reviews.Content: Travelling often to Rome, this Hotel was perfect! Central location, nice rooms, great atmosphere. Nice staff, helpful and friendly. Definitly a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worth reading this review”
Reviews.Author: Tinqua
Reviews.Content: There were 3 adults in our party, me, my husband and my mother in law (in her 70's) on a 4-day/3 night mini break. My husband and I had a double room on the second floor (room 215) at the back of the hotel and my M-I-L had a single room (204) on the second floor down the corridor from us but at the front of the hotel. After 2 nights, we asked for her to be moved to the back of the hotel because of the traffic noise in the mornings. She had much better nights sleep once she was moved. More on this later.... The Hotel Borromeo is situated on a long road; the road also has occasional pubs and restaurants. The Hotel is within easy reach on the bus terminal (a 10 minute walk through the main busy streets). Hotel looks a bit rough from the outside because of the graffiti, but Rome is covered in it everywhere. On entering, there is a (very) small reception area with the reception desk and a small a 'bar' area to the side of it (bar = a small counter with a small selection of spirits on a shelf). There is a small 2-seater sofa in the reception/bar area next to the main doors. Ground floor lift takes you to the bedrooms and the top floor 'restaurant' (restaurant = a small covered roof terrace) The restaurant has about 10 breakfast tables, that can seat up to 4 people at a squeeze and an island which has bread, cakes, yoghurt, cereals, boiled eggs, butter, jams, milk, orange juice, tea and coffee. Breakfast is self-service. The bedrooms are very small. A double bed (comfortable and clean but only one pillow each so if you want more you will need to ask, we did and they delivered promptly), sheets changed daily, a bedside table each side with a small drawer and lamp, a dressing table with drawers and a built in wardrobe with some shelving and small hanging space. You have about a foot either side of and at the base of the bed for additional room, so its basically in the door and only one person can stand in the floor space on either side of the bed (unless you want to get friendly!! - when in Rome x). The television has a remote control, only has one channel in English, which is CNN. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which proved to be a real negative, especially with M-I-L. Having said that, the receptionist will make you a hot drink in the 'bar' if you want one (charged to your room). There is no room service so we had to go and collect it via the lift ourselves. Safety deposit box functional and situated in the wardrobe. Bathroom has a loo, B-day and sink area and the tiniest bath I have ever seen! The white plastic shower curtain gets VERY friendly when having a shower, which is basically a showerhead in the bath - but its very hot and powerful. Large bath towels provided (changed every day) and hand towels (which are actually cotton table cloths). We has 3 sachets of shampoo, but none of the usual bath/shower gels etc provided, so if you book here, take all your own toiletries. The hair dryer is a standard on the wall hairdryer. Bedroom very warm with easy to use temperature controls. Also has air con. We were at the back of the hotel so no noise from the front street. If you book this hotel and are a light sleeper, tell them you don’t want a room facing the main road, it gets very noisy in the mornings with traffic (mainly motorbikes/mopeds). Fixtures and fittings could have done with a bit of TLC throughout the hotel and it could do with a bit of sprucing up in general. We literally used the hotel to shower, change and sleep. If you are looking for luxury (even just a bit) this is not the hotel for you. We wouldn’t stay here again, or recommend it to friends, unless they were young and just wanted to have somewhere to shower, change and sleep. Whenever we go away, and we do so quite frequently, we like to be able to relax in the room before going out to dinner, or sit in the bar for a few drinks and a chat before/after getting ready to go out for the evening.... we missed on this trip, because this hotel doent have the facility to do so. There are a lot of hotels in Rome, all very close to main attractions, and some very reasonable rates. You can’t go wrong with the areas as everything is in close proximity to all the attractions. I would definitely go back to Rome, but wouldn’t go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do believe the majority of the reviews! No customer service skills at all!”
Reviews.Author: Common-Senses
Reviews.Content: We have booked 3 rooms for 5 nights (in January, low season) for a special celebration week in Rome - our baby turning 1 and her mother 30 :) The hotel site advertised, at services provided, "Courtesy shuttle to/from airport". Since we had previously seen a similar promotion on a hotel booking site, where it said "On all bookings of four nights minimum stay, Roma Hotel Service include on the room rates complimentary transfer by car from the airport to the hotel" and assuming courtesy really means an act of goodwill, free of charge, we went ahead with the booking on their own website. We have requested Airport Transfer and as soon as the booking went through, an e-mail came back, saying that they charge 50 euro for the service. Writing back to let them know we've read otherwise, they asked for proof, which I provided in as much detail as possible! Afterwards, no answer. We finally called back to see what is going on, and did mention that we preferred Borromeo to other hotels with cheaper rooms, just because they offered this service which gives us, traveling with a child, peace of mind, not having to run after trains/cabs. Their suggestion? "Go ahead and cancel this reservation, go to the other hotel". When we asked to speak to the manager, we were not put through, but told that he has been talked to, and we are offered the free shuttle on our return!!!! Knowing that one is lost at the beginning of the trip, not in the last day, we asked if we could switch. Of course, no answer. So we went ahead and cancelled the reservation. For less money that left us with enough to pay cabs and 6 breakfasts for 5 days in a row, we managed to rent an apartment from www.romecityapartments.com We have not traveled yet, but I felt I should let everyone know that, what I afterwards read as reviews of awful staff and bad customer service, is, indeed, entirely true and should be taken in consideration. There are lots of other hotels in the same area, not to mention apartments, that you can pay for and get the best out of the entire Rome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tennis60
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a system where they can turn off the a/c at the front desk and we had to argue with them to turn on the a/c. I emailed them about the a/c before we went and were assured it was working. It does work but only if they turn it on at the front desk. It was not that hot while we were there so I feel that during the summer it could be a problem. We had a room in the back and it was quiet and he size was adequate. I have only been to Rome this time so I have no real comparison. The breakfast was European. Some of the front desk staff were friendly. Some were not so friendly. The hotel website responded quickly. The location though is very good and I always felt safe in the area. Dont feel though I can recommend this hotel. I would try higher ranked hotels from trip advisor first. Florida USA

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel for 150 Euros!”
Reviews.Author: SubaruSTi
Reviews.Content: We spent 15 days in Italy (4 different cities) and this hotel was the worst by far. The room smell horrible, the air conditioner did not work the second day, the bathroom was disgusting and the staff was very rude. The good reviews are placed by the hotel in this page! (notice exactly the same review in Spanish, Italian and English). As if this were not enough they charge additional taxes that are not in the original price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Needs Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: CharliePSoft
Reviews.Content: Booked quad room for my family and when we checked in we were told we were upgraded to suite (flat) which was "next door". Room was nice and big for 4 adults but was right on the street - like a motel on a highway in the US. Room was OK but fabrics, rugs, etc. really could use an upgrade. Since we were never shown the "regular" hotel, cannot judge if those rooms are better or not. Dbl-deadbolt door was not exactly totally secure since two large glass windows on either side of door could provide ready access to the room. Every time we left the room (for dinner, sight-seeing, etc.), we were requested to leave the room key. Staff was courteous although night clerk could speak little English and I speak even less Italian. When the stripe on the back of my credit card would not read, he could not understand my requests to enter the card number directly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: duncunator
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 10 days while we traveled to Rome for Easter (with my sister and brother in law) and absolutely loved it! It was just big enough to be comfortable and small enough to be quaint. With only 3 floors, we always took the adorable marble spiral stairs to each other’s rooms and the terrace. The terrace was one of the main reasons I booked it, along with complimentary breakfast, and it made the trip for me! Every morning we would start with breakfast including cereal, fruit, bread, pastries, eggs, ham, cheese, yogurt and all the regular breakfast drinks. The tables had real linens, with real silverware and china! The location was perfect! Easy walking distance to the Coliseum and Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and very importantly, the train station! There were lots of great restaurants on Via Cavour and a little market just across the street for room snacks. Great fresh vegetables and deli! We had a street side room with shutters and windows that opened fully. One day we spent the afternoon hanging out the window watching a parade! But at night, with the shutters and the double windows shut, the room was perfectly dark and quiet. The downside (plus upside) of the hotel was our first room smelled. After two days we realized that it was mold under the floor from a bad shower seal that made it leak. The concierge was great about it. We packed our bags in the morning and left our key at the desk. In the evening we got a new key and found our bags in that room! The shower was the only bad thing for me. They were small with thin cloth curtains that would blow in and stick to my legs. Life went on though. We saw 4 rooms in the hotel (my sister and her husband checked out for two days and came back) and they were all very clean and with their own unique décor and charm. The concierge spoke great English, and we felt safe and welcome for 10 great days in Rome! Finally notes: Spend the money to take a cab from the airport, it’s not that much more than the train and way easier than packing in with all the luggage and then walking three blocks. Even though we’re not big ‘outdoorsy’ people, my favorite days were an afternoon at Borghese Park, walking through Ancient Ostia and along the Mediteranian, and renting bikes for a trip through Appia Antica Park. I have lots of info about Easter in Rome, Mass at the Vatican, the Pope and whatnot if anyone wants it.

Reviews.Title: “Good locaton, but unpleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: barbic01
Reviews.Content: Hotel as such is OK, location is good, but my husband and I had problem with hotel pickup service. They offered me pickup service from airport for 50 EUR that I accepted, knowing that we should arrive in Rome at 23.30h. They asked me for flight details, and I provided them with flight number and expected arrival time (thinking that it is normal that they need my flight details because they will call airport and check if flight is late). Flight was 2,5 hours late from Frankfurt, and nobody was waiting for us when we arrived. We paid transport to hotel 65EUR (!!!) and then, when we arrived, hotel wanted to charge us 50EUR for service they never delivered! They claimed that driver called airport before going to pick us up and airport confirmed that flight is arriving on time (at that moment we were still waiting in Frankfurt airport, so we weren't even in the plane!). Eventually, after big argue next morning, we didn't pay that 50EUR, but only because (as receptionist said) they missed to include disclaimer in mail sent to me that I will have to guarantee for that service with my credit card (!?). So, be sure to ask how long will they wait for you if you are late. Needless to say, we were very nervous because of that and they ruined our first night and first day in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: grantem2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights in a family quad room with our sons, aged 13 and 11. The room was compact, but big enough. The hotel location suited us very well, and we were made very welcome by the staff. Rooftop terrace is a welcome bonus, as is the breakfast included in the price (and there was a limited fruit selection with breakfast when we were there.) Free wireless internet access was also a pleasant surprise (there was no access from our room, but it worked well on the 3rd floor terrace. Note that you need to get an access code card from reception, and that you need your passport or other id for this.) Our room did not overlook Via Cavour and we were not disturbed by street noise. I am imagine it is quite noisy if you overlook Via Cavour. Concerned about other posts saying that confirmed reservations had not been honoured, I contacted the hotel in advance and asked advice about travelling from the airport. They then arranged a car to collect us; a very nice Mercedes turned up and we were delighted. We'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittlePPod
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 night stay at the Borromeo and a generally fantastic time in Rome. We arrived in the evening and to be honest the first impression of our room was not brilliant. However the following morning with the curtains and shutters thrown back the room became very light, airy and sunny. We had the "suite" on the third floor which had an outside terrace area, it was just a shame that we didn't really have the weather to make use of it. The room was basic and probably did need a bit of TLC but on the whole it was very clean with towels and linens changed regularly. Location-wise it was perfect, easy walking distance from the Colusseum area, the Termini and most other tourist areas of Rome. Even the Vatican was do-able if you put your mind to it. Lots of great restaurants within strolling distance of the hotel which was great after a long day on your feet (and also great after a bottle of red and an Ameretto with your dinner!)

Reviews.Title: “Your confirmation email may not be valid!”
Reviews.Author: SLPMadrid
Reviews.Content: If your credit card is not accepted at the time of booking, the hotel will not notify you of this and will cancel your booking. Unfortunately you will still be sent a confirmation email for your booking and will therefore think that your booking is confirmed. Only on arrival at the hotel will you be informed that your booking is cancelled and in my case that the hotel is full. This is not too useful at 10.30pm on a Friday night. The hotel staff upon arrival were quite unconcerned by the cancellation and did not seem to find anything wrong in sending confirmation emails to customers whose bookings they had cancelled. Infact I was not the only person queuing at reception with this problem! Luckily it was not high season and there were other hotels with vacancies in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: boonut
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after hours of searching for a suitable hotel - I wanted one that was reasonably priced and in a good location. I'm glad I booked this one over others I considered, as this was situated really well for exploring Rome. It was only a five minute walk from the main Termini station and also had another metro station just down the road. From the outside the hotel looks very nice and the reception area is quite impressive. I have to admit I was slightly disappointed with the room when we first arrived, as it could have done with a coat of paint, and it looked a little dated. However, it was very clean and had all the necessary facilities, such as safe, tv, hairdryer and even a minibar. The breakfast could have been better, but I would guess that most of the hotels serve similar things. Here there was bread, cheese, ham, egg, cereal etc. There are several restaurants located very close to the hotel (literally 20 seconds away!) mainy pizzeria's. There are also a couple of bars and also touristy shops. This is great if you fancy a meal or some drinks without going far. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel, even if its only for the great location - it really is an ideal base for seeing the city as it's so easy to get to the train station, and it's also in walking distance to plenty of nice restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Needed.”
Reviews.Author: looksshiny
Reviews.Content: For a weekend in Rome, we found Borromeo to be the perfect choice. There was nothing exceptional about the hotel, but a good price, clean & comfortable rooms, very good location and helpful and accommodating staff made it exactly what we needed. There are a number of really good restaurants very close by, and only 5 mins walk to Termini station! Watch the taxi drivers there though, charged my friend EUR30 to get to the hotel, and it really is close enough to walk... Saw them coming I think.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: catypops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about five minutes walk from the termini and about ten minute walk from the colloseum. Although it is on a main road we didn't suffer any road noise and i think it is a good base to explore the city. The room was ok not huge but not cramped either, it had a bath and shower, safe and t.v only CNN in english if you didnt use pay t.v. The breakfast was nice, croissants, cereal, meat, eggs, yogurts tea and coffee were on offer and served until 10. The room was cleaned every day and the staff on reception were extemely helpful, providing maps and guide books and recommended restaraunts and places to see. Looking at other hotels when we were there, for the money i would stay here again, it was 100e per night for triple room and we contacted the hotel directly. I've rated this above average because of the location and price, there is cheaper but i took the address' and google earth shows in exellent detail where they are!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauAgent
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is definitely walking distance from the Terminal we found this after paying 15 euros for the privilege. The location is faultless 5 - 10 minute walk to the coliseum on a slightly busy road but the shutters and double glazing along with a bottle of Italy’s finest red meant we had no problems sleeping. After checking in we were informed that we would have to swap rooms after the 1st night this somewhat disturbed our 3 night stay. At least we got to see 2 rooms; the first room was large but very tired the walls dirty and the double bed was two singles pushed together. The bathroom was fine but the shower holder was broken. The layout reminded me of a hostel with a small reception being the only representation of a hotel, the rooms just ran directly above this and the large banging doors, thin walls and an American neighbour with bronchitis meant for a noisy stay. Our second room was slightly better the wallpapered walls made this more homely but these too were well overdue a lick of paint. Again the bathroom was fine but like our previous room the shower holder was broken, consequently every shower during the stay was a struggle. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English however, I was somewhat concerned regarding the safety of our passports as when we collected them they were lying on the front desk within reach of any Luigi public. We only had breakfast in the hotel once and this was as expected, basic, but it was fine although we had to negotiate the workmen on the top floor where the building work was taking place. I would recommend this hotel as a base for exploring the beautiful city but nothing more (CNN can be slightly repetitive CNN can be slightly repetitive CNN can be slightly repetitive). For the money we really had no complaints.
